children.name: sexy
children.definition: /ˈseksi/  sexually attractive to people, either because of your body, your good looks, or attractive personality:
examples: quyến rũ
▪ Peter is strong, good looking, and very sex.
Peter mạnh mẽ, đẹp trai, và rất quyến rũ.
▪ The advertisement showed a sexy young woman in a short skirt standing beside a sports car.
Quảng cáo cho thấy một phụ nữ trẻ gợi cảm trong chiếc váy ngắn đứng bên cạnh một chiếc xe thể thao.
▪ Her flushed cheeks, wide eyes, and slightly opened mouth made her look sexy.
Má đỏ hây, đôi mắt to và miệng hở nhẹ làm cho cô ấy trông thật quyến rũ.
sexiness[uncountable noun]sự quyến rũ
▪ I think I was first attracted to her overt sexiness.
Tôi nghĩ rằng lần đầu tiên tôi bị thu hút bởi sự quyến rũ của cô ấy.
sexyadjectiveSEX
sexually attractive
_He's very sexy.
_a sexy smile
_sexy underwear

children.name: attractive
children.definition: /əˈtræktɪv/  someone who is attractive has a personality or appearance that makes other people sexually attracted to them:
examples: hấp dẫn
▪ It’s enough for me that my husband thinks I’m sexually attractive.
Chồng tôi nghĩ tôi hấp dẫn tình dục và thế là đủ với tôi.
attractive to
Hấp dẫn với
▪ I don’t know what makes Jamie so attractive to women.
Tôi không biết điều gì khiến Jamie hấp dẫn phụ nữ thế.
find somebody attractive
Thấy ai đó hấp dẫn
think they are attractive
▪ She’s very nice but I don’t really find her attractive.
Cô ấy rất đẹp nhưng tôi không thấy cô ấy hấp dẫn.

children.name: sex appeal
children.definition: /ˈseks əˌpiːl/  someone’s appearance, behaviour, or personality that makes them sexually attractive:
examples: sự gợi cảm
▪ Tanya uses her sex appeal to get whatever she wants.
Tanya sử dụng sự gợi cảm của mình để có được bất cứ điều gì cô ấy muốn.
have sex appeal
có sức hút
▪ Barry’s a really nice guy, but he has absolutely no sex appeal.
Barry là một chàng trai thực sự tốt, nhưng anh ấy hoàn toàn không có sức hút.

children.name: desirable
children.definition: /dɪˈzaɪərəbəl/ formalsomeone who is desirable makes you feel sexually attracted to them:
examples: ▪ Ray was still in good shape and far more desirable than most men his age.
Ray vẫn còn rất lực lưỡng và nhiều ham muốn hơn so với hầu hết đàn ông tuổi của ông.

children.name: voluptuous
children.definition: /vəˈlʌptʃuəs/  a woman who isvoluptuoushaslargebreastsand an attractive,roundedbody, so that men feel sexually attracted to her:

children.name: nóng bỏng ( ngực khủng, mông to )
examples: ▪ Everyone turned to look at Gordon and his voluptuous mistress as they entered the room.
Mọi người quay lại nhìn Gordon và người tình nóng bỏng của anh khi họ bước vào phòng.

children.name: alluring
children.definition: /əˈljʊərɪŋǁəˈlʊə-/ writtena woman who isalluringattracts men in a sexual way, because she seems to beexcitingand a littlemysterious:

children.name: quyến rũ ( theo cách bí ẩn )
examples: ▪ Helene was an alluring beauty whom few men could resist.
Helene là một vẻ đẹp quyến rũ mà ít người đàn ông có thể kháng cự.
▪ She was encouraged to use her feminine charms, to be coy and alluring.
Cô ấy được khuyến khích sử dụng sự lôi cuốn nữ tính, e thẹn và quyến rũ của mình.

children.name: to talk to sb in a way that shows you are attracted to them
flirt
children.definition: /flɜːʳt/  to talk to and behave towards someone as though you are sexually attracted to them, so that they will pay attention to you:
examples: tán tỉnh, thả thính
▪ She was flirting and trying to get the waiter’s attention.
flirt with tán tỉnh với
▪ It embarrasses me when you flirt with other women in front of me.
▪ No one had flirted with me in years, and I didn’t really know how to respond.
flirtverb[ I ]
to behave as if sexually attracted to someone, although not seriously
_Christina was flirtingwithjust about every man in the room.
flirtnoun[ C ]
someone who behaves as if they are sexually attracted to a lot of people
_He's a compulsive flirt.

children.name: chat sb up
children.definition: chat up/ˌtʃæt ˈʌp/  British to talk to someone in a way that shows you are sexually attracted to them, in order to try and make them interested in you:
examples: tán tỉnh, thả thính
chat somebody up thả thính với ai đó
▪ I’m not in the mood to go to bars and wait for sad men to try to chat me up.
chat up somebody thả thính ai đó
▪ When I left the party Kelly was still chatting up that tall guy in the kitchen.
chatsbupphrasal verb[ M ]UKinformal
to talk to someone in a way that shows them that you are sexually attracted to them
_He spent all evening chatting her up and buying her drinks.

children.name: be a turn-off
children.definition: /biː ə ˈtɜːʳn ɒf/ informalto be not at all sexually attractive:chán ngấy, làm mất hứng
examples: ▪ I wish you wouldn’t wear your socks in bed - it’s such a turn-off.
Anh ước em không đeo tất của mình trên giường - thiệt mất hứng.

children.name: sexless
children.definition: /ˈseksləs/  British not sexually attractive, because of not having any strong male or female qualities:

children.name: thờ ơ tình dục
examples: ▪ I don’t find him attractive at all, he’s such a sexless lump.
Tôi không thấy anh ấy hấp dẫn chút nào, anh ấy là một kẽ đần thờ ơ tình dục.

children.name: sth of sb that are sexually attractive
sexy
children.definition: /ˈseksi/  sexually attractive:
examples: quyến rũ
▪ He’s got a really deep sexy voice.
Anh ấy có giọng nói rất quyến rũ.
I think leather pants are really sexy.
Tôi nghĩ quần da thật sự quyến rũ.
▪ Gabby dived into the pool leaving her sexy black dress draped over a chair.
Gabby lặn xuống hồ bơi để lại chiếc váy đen gợi cảm của cô che trên ghế.
sexyadjectiveSEX
sexually attractive
_He's very sexy.
_a sexy smile
_sexy underwear

children.name: sensual /sensuous X
children.definition: sensual/sensuous/ˈsenʃuəl, ˈsenʃuəs/  seeming to show strong sexual feelings and a desire for sexual pleasure:
examples: gợi cảm
▪ Peter leaned forward and kissed the girl’s sensual red lips.
Peter nghiêng người về phía trước và hôn lên đôi môi màu đỏ gợi cảm của cô gái.
▪ The artist became obsessed by her strange, sensual beauty.
Nghệ sĩ bị ám ảnh bởi vẻ đẹp kỳ lạ, gợi cảm
sensuality/ˌsenʃuˈælɪti, ˌsenʃuˈæləti/ [uncountable noun]sự gợi cảm
▪ The sensuality of the woman’s face was emphasized by her off-the-shoulder dress.
Sự gợi cảm của khuôn mặt phụ nữ được tô đậm bởi bộ váy hở vai.

children.name: provocative
children.definition: /prəˈvɒkətɪvǁ-ˈvɑː-/  intended to make someone feel sexually excited :
examples: provocatively[adverb]mộtcáchkhiêu gợi
▪ ‘Why don’t you show me,’ said Rhonda, parting her lips provocatively.
'Tại sao bạn không chỉ cho tôi,' Rhonda nói, đôi môi mỉm cười khêu gợi.

children.name: khiêu gợi
examples: ▪ The magazine is full of pictures of partially dressed women in provocative poses.
Tạp chí có đầy đủ hình ảnh của phụ nữ ăn mặc một mảnh trong các tư thế đầy khiêu dâm.

children.name: seductive
children.definition: /sɪˈdʌktɪv/  very sexually attractive, and making you want to have sex, especially when youshould not
examples: dụ dỗ:
▪ From across the room, I noticed that Philip was giving me a seductive stare.
Từ khắp phòng, tôi nhận thấy rằng Philip đã cho tôi một cái nhìn quyến rũ.

children.name: suggestive
children.definition: /səˈdʒestɪvǁsəg-/  are intended to make you think about sex:
examples: suggestively[adverb] 1 cách gợi tình
▪ The young women were dancing suggestively to the music.
Những phụ nữ trẻ đang nhảy múa gợi tình cùng âm nhạc.

children.name: gợi tình, gợi dục
examples: ▪ Several of the most sexually suggestive scenes have been cut from the film.
Một số cảnh khêu gợi nhất đã được cắt từ bộ phim.

children.name: ▪ Victor winked at her, and his smile was so wickedly suggestive that Francesca blushed
examples: Victor nháy mắt với cô, và nụ cười của anh ta đã gợi tình một cách tinh quái làm Francesca đỏ mặt.

children.name: be a turn-on
children.definition: /biː ə ˈtɜːʳn ɒn/ informalsomething that you think it is sexually exciting:

children.name: hấp dẫn
examples: ▪ The sight of all those half-naked men may be a turn-on to some women, but I find it unappealing.
Cái nhìn của tất cả những người đàn ông bán khỏa thân này có thể rất hấp dẫn đối với một số phụ nữ, nhưng tôi thấy nó không hấp dẫn.

children.name: to be sexually attracted to sb
be attracted to
children.definition: /biː əˈtræktd tuː/
examples: to feel attracted to someone so that you would like to have a sexual relationship with them:bị thu hút bởi
▪ I’ve always been very attracted to blondes.
Tôi luôn bị thu hút bởi những cô gái tóc vàng.
▪ I don’t know why I was ever attracted to him in the first place.
Tôi không biết tại sao lần đầu tiên tôi bị cuốn hút bởi anh ta.
strongly attracted to
Bị thu hút mạnh mẽ
▪ She didn’t really like him as a person, but she felt strongly attracted to him.
Cô ấy không thực sự thích anh ta, nhưng cô ấy cảm thấy bị thu hút mạnh mẽ bởi anh ta.
attractverb
[ T usually passive ] If you are attracted by or to someone, you like them, often finding them sexually interesting.
_I'm notphysically/sexuallyattracted to him.

children.name: fancy
children.definition: /ˈfænsi/  Britishinformalto be sexually attracted to someone:
examples: thích
▪ Everyone knows you fancy Sara. Why don’t you ask her out?
Mọi người đều biết bạn yêu thích Sara. Tại sao bạn không hỏi cô ấy?
▪ Fenella really fancied the drummer and went over to chat to him after the concert.
Fenella thực sự thích các tay trống và bắt đầu trò chuyện với anh ta sau buổi hòa nhạc.
fancyverbLIKE
[ T ]mainlyUKinformalto be sexually attracted to someone
_He could tell she fancied him.

children.name: be interested in
children.definition: /biː ˈɪntrstd ɪn/  to feel sexually attracted to someone, used especially when you are beingpoliteand do not want to say that you have sexual feelings for them:

children.name: thích thú
examples: ▪ She’s not really been interested in anyone since the divorce.
Cô ta không thực sự thích thú với bất cứ ai sau khi ly hôn.

children.name: want
children.definition: /wɒntǁwɔːnt/  to feel very attracted to someone and to want to have sex with them:
examples: khao khát
▪ ‘I want you,’ she whispered, ‘I want you now.’
"Em khao khát anh," cô ấy thầm thì, "Em khao khát anh ngay giờ này."
▪ He was obsessed with her and wanted her desperately.
Anh bị cô ám ảnh và khao khát cô kinh khủng.

children.name: lust after
children.definition: /ˈlʌst ɑːftəʳǁ-æf-/ informalto be strongly sexually attracted to someone and think about having sex with them :
examples: thèm khát, ham muốn
▪ You must really enjoy it, having all those fans lusting after you!
Bạn phải thực sự thích nó, có tất cả những người hâm mộ thèm khát bạn!
lust aftersbphrasal verb
to feel sexualdesirefor someone you are not having a sexual relationship with
_She's been lusting after Dave for months.

children.name: an attraction to
children.definition: attractionnoun

children.name: to look at sb in a way that shows you are sexually interested in them
leer
children.definition: /lɪəʳ/  to look and smile at someone in a way that shows a strong sexual interest, especially so that people feel a little frightened, embarrassed, or offended:
examples: ▪ ‘Hey, baby. Do you like what you see?’ he said, leering.
leer at
▪ The old man leered suggestively at the waitress.
▪ Stopping his work for a second, the garage attendant leered at the girls in the car.
leer[singular noun]
▪ He stood in the doorway, with a leer on his face, refusing to let her past.
leerverb[ I ] liếc mắt dâm dật
(especially of men) to look at someone in an unpleasant andsexuallyinterested way
_He was always leeringatfemale members of staff.
leernoun[ C ] cái liếc mắt dâm dật
a drunken leer

children.name: ogle
children.definition: /ˈəʊgəl/  to look at someone in an offensive way that shows you are sexually attracted to their body:
examples: ▪ A group of men were ogling her from a bench across the street.
▪ The beach was full of teenage boys who had come to ogle the girls in bikinis.
ogleverb[ I or T ] nhìn hau háu; nhìn chòng chọc
to look at someone withobvious sexualinterest
I saw you ogling the woman in the red dress!

children.name: eye up
children.definition: /ˌaɪ ˈʌp/ Britishinformalto look at someone in a way that shows that you are sexually interested in them:
examples: eye somebody up/eye up somebody
▪ I’m not sure if he’s eyeing me up or just staring at me.
▪ Those two have been eyeing each other up all evening.
eyesbupphrasal verb[ M ]informal
to look at someone with sexual interest
That guy in the grey jacket has been eyeing you up all evening.

children.name: make eyes at
children.definition: /ˌmeɪk ˈaɪz æt/  to make it clear to someone that you are sexually attracted to them by looking at them in a way that gets their attention:
examples: ▪ Did you see those two making eyes at each other across the table?
